Exhibition htmleventsotcconferencehtml RESCHEDULED MEETINGS The IADCSPE Middle East Drilling Technology Conference and Exhibition has been rescheduled for March in Bahrain FIND THE TECHNOLOGY The Fourth International Symposium on Oilfield Scale January Aberdeen offers focused technical presentations related to the research and application of mineral scale control The twoday event covers case histories challenging environments scale inhibition challenges emerging technologies and the economics of scale management Registration is available through January For more information and to register visit specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Conference registration and housing forms for the IADCSPE Drilling Conference February Dallas are available online Also see wholl be exhibiting and what technology will be discussed at specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Partnership for a Sustainable Future is the theme of the Sixth SPE International Conference on Health Safety and Environment in Oil and Gas Exploration and Production March Kuala Lumpur Planned are three plenary sessions panel sessions technical sessions and one poster session For more information and to register visit specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml As the largest and most diversified conference related to preventing diagnosing and remediating formation damage the SPE International Symposium and Exhibition on Formation Damage Control February Lafayette Louisiana USA will offer sessions designed to bridge the tasks expected of reservoir drilling production and geological professionals Find out more at specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml SPE Forum Series in Asia Pacific Nusa Dua Indonesia Forum I The Continuing Role of Well Testing May specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Forum II Delivering the ft ERD Well May specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Find useitnow technology in your technical interests or specialties at any of the following SPE Applied Technology Workshops Gas Utilization and Disposal April Phuket Thailand aims to facilitate sharing experiences and recent technological advances for maximizing the efficiency with which gas can be exploited and reducing negative environmental and economic impacts specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Production Enhancement April Kota Kinabalu Sabah Malaysia will focus on incrementally increasing production based upon case histories and working examples that include application of new and existing technology automationartificial intelligence cost reduction business partnerships and statisticalanalytical methods specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Case studies will be the focus of Off Well Site Decision Making April Austin Texas USA Issues to be explored include offsite optimization of drilling operations what works and what doesnt integration of drilling and GG information offsite monitoring and management of major rig equipment offsite optimization of nondrilling operations such as completions stimulation offsite decision making as a way to leverage and share knowledge and psychological and cultural issues involved in transferring part of rig decision making activity off site specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Geomechanics Applications for Reservoir Exploitation April May Kota Kinabalu Sabah Malaysia is targeted to develop and enhance the understanding of each professionals role in the overall management of geomechanics in todays operating environment specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Drilling geological petrophysical and geomechanics engineers involved in petroleum well construction can benefit from Real Time Wellbore Stability May Houston Presenters will address limitations of current technology and future developments specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml EBusiness in the Petroleum Industry June Singapore will focus in discussing the various applications of ebusiness for the industry the implications in work processes and change management obstacles and potential benefits for operators and service companies current practices developments and future trends specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Post plateau and decline period in a fields life cycle curve is the focus of the third workshop on Field Management of Mature Reservoirs June Scheveningen The Netherlands Discussions include technical challenges best practices case histories risk management and people management Deadline for receipt of applications is March For the workshop brochure andor to submit an application please visit specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml AUTHOR OPPORTUNITIES Want to author a paper for presentation at an SPE meeting Here are upcoming opportunities Value Creation Through Appropriate Technology Transforming Opportunities into Realities is the theme of the IADCSPE Asia Pacific Drilling Technology Conference September Jakarta Indonesia To explore possible paper proposal categories or to submit a paper proposal visit specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Technology for Tomorrows Reservoirs is the theme for Europec October Aberdeen Areas of interest sought include deep water individual technologies subsea construction economic value of data production optimization risk management wellreservoir modeling and increasing recovery factors View guidelines and the submission form at specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Creative Solutions for Maturing Basins and New Frontiers is the theme of the SPE Asia Pacific Oil Gas Conference and Exhibition October Melbourne Australia Seeking paper proposals on gas technology business uncertainty and risk well construction knowledge management EOR facilities optimization management of maturing fields reservoir characterization case studies and other categories To see all of the categories and submit a paper proposal visit specdaviewseventseventMasterhtml Are you an expert in your field SPEs technical journals the Definitive Technical Series seek technical editors to contribute their expertise to SPE Journal SPE Drilling Completion SPE Production Facilities or SPE Reservoir Evaluation Engineering Apply online at specdaviewssharedviewHtmlMasterhtml SPE CALENDAR For a list of upcoming Society events visit specdaviewseventschannelMasterhtml xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx wwwspeorg The Society of Petroleum Engineers Inc SPE is pleased to send you this issue of the SPE eUpdate a monthly bulletin that provides the latest information and directly links you to more details on Society meetings membership and products and services as well as SPE Online and other news of interest xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx HOW TO UNSUBSCRIBE xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx The SPE eUpdate is a service to SPE members and friends If you have suggestions or comments please send them to If you do not wish to receive this newsletter in the future send a message to with SPE eUpdate in the subject line and the phrase unsubscribe newsletter in the text Please include your member name or your member number The Society of Petroleum Engineers PO Box Richardson TX USA wwwspeorg If you have received the SPE eUpdate in error please accept our apology
